intro: Ozothamnus lanceolatus, commonly known as the slender oat-grass, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the family Asteraceae and is characterized by its erect, branched stems and narrow, lance-shaped leaves. The plant produces small, yellowish to brownish flowers arranged in dense, cylindrical clusters. It typically grows in dry, sandy soils and is often found in open habitats such as grasslands and heathlands. Ozothamnus lanceolatus is drought-tolerant and has adapted to thrive in arid and semi-arid environments.
